ParamComposite Class Reference
Parameter File IO

Detailed Description

An object that can read multiple parameters from file.

Any class that reads parameters from the input parameter file must be derived from ParamComposite. The format of the associated block of a parameter file is defined by the implementation of the virtual readParam() method. The readParam() method of each subclass is implemented using protected methods provided by ParamComposite to read any number of individual parameters, and any number of "child" ParamComposite objects. The fact that a readParam() method method can invoke readParam() methods of other ParamComposite objects allows a file format to be defined as a hierarchical tree, in which each ParamComposite object is a node and each parameter is a leaf.

Each ParamComposite has a private array of pointers to ParamComponent objects, stored in the order in which they are read from file by the readParam() method. We will refer to this as the format array. Each element of the format array may point to a Parameter object (which represents a single parameter), a Begin or End object (which represents a line containing the opening or closing bracket for a parameter block), a Blank object (i.e., a blank line), or another ParamComposite object.

The ParamComposite::writeParam() method writes the parameter file block by sequentially invoking the writeParam() method of each of the objects in the format array. This allows the writeParam() method to reproduce the file format that is defined by the readParam() method.

The readParam() method of each subclass of ParamComposite should be implemented using the methods read < T >, readBegin, readEnd, readBlank, and readParamComposite. Each of these methods creates a new object of the specified type, adds a pointer to the new object to the format array, and then invokes the the readParam method of the new object in order to read the associated line or block of the parameter file:

readBegin(): The readBegin() method reads the opening line for the block associated with a ParamComposite, and adds a pointer to a new Begin object to the format array. The opening line should contain the class name followed by an opening bracket, as in "MyClass{". Each Begin object has a class name string.
read(): The read < T >() method template reads a single parameter of type T from stream and adds an associated ScalaraParam<T> object object to the format array. This template may be used with any type T for which an inserter (>>) and extractor (<<) are defined. Each ScalarParam object contains a Label object and a pointer to the associated parameter variable.
readParamComposite(): The readParamComposite() method adds a pointer to a child ParamComposite object to the format array, and invokes the readParam() method of the child in order to read a nested subblock of of the parameter file.
readBlank(): The readBlank method add a pointer to a Blank object to the format array, indicating a blank line.
readEnd(): The readEnd method reads a line containing the closing bracket for the block associated with a ParamComposite, and adds a pointer to a new End object to the format array.

Other specialized read methods are provided for 1D and 2D C arrays.

read* methods

Each of these method invokes an associated add* method to create a new ParamComponent object, and then invoke the readParam() method of the new object to read the associated line or block of a file.

Member Function Documentation

void resetParam ( ) [virtual]

Resets ParamComposite to its empty state.

This method deletes Parameter, Begin, End, and Blank objects in the format list, recursively invokes resetParam() for any ParamComposite objects in the list, nullifies all pointers in the list, and resets the number of items in the list to 0.

Reimplemented from ParamComponent.

Definition at line 87 of file ParamComposite.cpp.

void writeParam ( std::ostream &  out) [virtual]

Write all parameters to an output stream.

This default implementation writes all parameters to file, descending children recursively.

Parameters:
outoutput stream for reading

Implements ParamComponent.
